intro: Bertiera ferrugrinea, commonly known as the rusty bertiera, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers that are often clustered in umbels. The plant has rough, hairy leaves that are typically ovate or elliptic in shape. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in coastal areas. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, wind-dispersed seeds.
